citation.article-title: Pontibacillus chungwhensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a moderately halophilic Gram-positive bacterium from a solar saltern in Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Pontibacillus (Pon.ti.ba.cil′lus. L. n. pontus the sea; L. dim. n. bacillus small rod; N.L. masc. n. Pontibacillus bacillus pertaining to the sea).
Spherical endospores are formed terminally in swollen sporangia.
Cells are motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Cell wall peptidoglycan contains A1γ type meso-DAP.
DNA G+C content is 40·8–41·5 mol% (HPLC method).
Predominant cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0 on MA.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the family Bacillaceae.
The type species is Pontibacillus chungwhensis.
